---
  description: Creates plot from empirical cumulative distribution computation and then convert them with ggplotly
  function: stat_ecdf
  permalink: /ggplot2/layers/Stats/stat_ecdf/
  layout: base
  language: ggplot2
  name: stat_ecdf
  reference: https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/
---

# Default plot 

<pre class="mcode">
df <- data.frame(
  x = c(rnorm(100, 0, 3), rnorm(100, 0, 10)),
  g = gl(2, 100)
)
p <-   
 ggplot(df, aes(x)) +
  stat_ecdf(geom = "step")
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Stop plot from going to infinity

<pre class="mcode">
df <- data.frame(
  x = c(rnorm(100, 0, 3), rnorm(100, 0, 10)),
  g = gl(2, 100)
)
p <-   
 ggplot(df, aes(x)) +
  stat_ecdf(geom = "step", pad = FALSE)
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Multiple ECDFs


<pre class="mcode">
df <- data.frame(
  x = c(rnorm(100, 0, 3), rnorm(100, 0, 10)),
  g = gl(2, 100)
)
p <-   
 ggplot(df, aes(x, colour = g)) +
  stat_ecdf()
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>
